definition[0]: the type of activity or subject that a person or organization seems most interested in and gives most attention to
example[0]: The company needs to develop a stronger orientation towards marketing its products.
example[1]: How can we get students to adopt a serious orientation to learning?
example[2]: He was unhappy with the commercial orientation of the organization.
definition[1]: the political opinions or religious beliefs that someone has
example[3]: The party has a broadly socialist orientation.
example[4]: The meeting is open to everyone, whatever their political or religious orientation.
definition[2]: a period of time during which people are trained and prepared for a new job or course of study
example[5]: This is orientation week for all the new students.
definition[3]: the angle or position of an object, or the direction in which it is facing
definition[4]: the type of activity or thing that a business or organization gives most attention to
definition[5]: a period of time during which people who have just joined a company or organization are trained or given information
example[6]: All new employees attend a number of orientation sessions.
